intro: Disperanthoceros, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow and orange. The plants typically grow in woodland areas and are found in parts of Asia and the Americas. Disperanthoceros species often have lance-shaped leaves and produce capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. These plants are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
